thread.title: Debunked myths that a lot of people still believe (18 Photos)
thread.title_full: Debunked myths that a lot of people still believe (18 Photos)

author: Hendy
title: Debunked myths that a lot of people still believe (18 Photos)
text:
source 
The colour red drives bulls insane 
Bulls actually see the colour red as another shade of grey. What gets them nice and angry is actually the constant waving of the flag itself. 2 source 
An earthworm that is split in two will become two earthworms 
As cool as that sounds, it’s actually just the front half of the worm that will continue to live. 3 
Dogs see the world in black and white 
Dogs see colour, they just don’t see it as vibrantly as we do. 4 source 
De-oxygenated blood is blue 
The reality is that blood is never actually blue. It is always a shade of red. The reason why it appears blue in some veins is because of the fact that blue wavelengths of light are the only ones that have the ability to penetrate to the depth that those veins are beneath the skin. 5 
Goldfish have a memory span of 5 seconds 
That’d be awful. Luckily this isn’t true, as goldfish actually have a pretty decent memory. Advertisement 6 
Camels store water in their humps 
As much as I’d love to believe that one, it turns out their humps are just filled with fat. 7 
Lightning doesn’t strike the same spot twice 
It does, that’s what lightning rods are for. 8 source 
It takes 7 years for you to digest your swallowed gum 
Gee, thanks Magic School Bus! The reality is that while it is indigestible, swallowed gum will pass through your body as fast as anything else you eat. 9 source 
Vitamin C stops you from getting sick 
Unfortunately popping vitamin C tablets like candy wont stop that cold from coming. It will, however, shorten the amount of time it stays. 10 source 
That there are right brained and left brained people 
While some things we do activate one side or the other of our brains, this has no actual impact on our individual personalities. Advertisement
